sait.mms.managers

Class MovieManagementSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • sait.mms.managers.MovieManagementSystem

  • public class MovieManagementSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Description: Movie Management system that connects to the movies database and allows users to add, delete, and print movies.
    Author:
    YunZe (David) Wei, Rafael Oporto, Saurav Adhikari

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Scanner in 
      MariaDBDriver mb 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MovieManagementSystem() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMovie()
      Asks the user for the movie title, duration and release year to add to the database.
      int count()
      Counts how many rows there are in the database for error checking purposes
      void deleteMovie()
      Deletes a movie entry from the movies database using a movie id typed in by the user.
      void displayMenu()
      Method that loops to keep displaying user options till the user enters 5.
      void exit()
      exits the program
      void printMoviesInYear()
      This method gets the user to enter a year and retrieves all the movies released in that year from the movies table.
      void printRandomMovies()
      This method gets the user to enter a number and retrieves a list of random movies from the movies table adding up to that number.

      • displayMenu

        public void displayMenu()
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Method that loops to keep displaying user options till the user enters 5.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throws an error statement if there is a problem running the sql query

      • addMovie

        public void addMovie()
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Asks the user for the movie title, duration and release year to add to the database. Error checking to allow numbers only for duration and release year entry. Try catch to catch any SQLException If all user entry is satisfactory the movie is added on a new row with their entries.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throws an error statement if there is a problem running the sql query

      • printMoviesInYear

        public void printMoviesInYear()
        This method gets the user to enter a year and retrieves all the movies released in that year from the movies table. Try catch to catch any SQLException.

      • printRandomMovies

        public void printRandomMovies()
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method gets the user to enter a number and retrieves a list of random movies from the movies table adding up to that number. Try catch to catch any SQLException.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteMovie

        public void deleteMovie()
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes a movie entry from the movies database using a movie id typed in by the user.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • count

        public int count()
          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Counts how many rows there are in the database for error checking purposes
        Returns:
        total count of database rows
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • exit

        public void exit()
        exits the program
